TopicTitle: [Video] Heat Shielded Probe Lands On Eve

Articles.Content: Just a heat shield test I did on a probe, was also a test for some new codecs I been tweaking about with.
Why did you put ion engine on your probe? Was it firing through heat shield during deorbit burn?

The ion engine was for emergency situations, if the interplanetary drive ceased to function; the ion engine would get me some where one way or another.

Facts:

The interplanetary drive had actually ran out of fuel before I managed to get into a proper orbit and so decided to go for a head on trajectory with eve, yet was still successful due to deploying the parachute a bit too early in hope that the heat shield was big enough to protect it as it trailed behind the probe.
